item.title: Andrew Dessler
item.description: Calls/emails from reporters asking for a comment on last's years temperature are coming earlier than normal this year. Time to dust off my "last year was hot" auto-response.

item.title: European Commission
item.description:
One year has gone by and kunas have become euros! üá≠üá∑üí∂In 2023, Croatia became the 20th country to introduce the euro, a symbol of our European unity and sovereignty.It was a great day for the people of Croatia and Europeans across the euro area.
This year, we mark another significant anniversary ‚Äì 25 years of the euro.Let's grow stronger together!#EUROinCroatia

item.title: Matteo Farinella
item.description: "We have taken on the biggest question facing humanity ‚Äî how the brain works ‚Äî and we need as many brains as possible to answer it. If we keep writing inscrutable papers, we silo knowledge away from those who can help." Words of wisdom from my friend @KanakaRajanPhD - she's using comics to demystify computational neuroscience üëèhttps://hms.harvard.edu/news/building-models-brain-take-them-apart#scicomm #neuroscience #accessibility

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: Did you know you can run QUEST staircases out of box in online experiments? Try the demo and view template psychopy files to get started here üëâ https://pavlovia.org/demos/staircase_quest Enabled via jsQuest https://github.com/kurokida/jsQUEST

item.title: Karen Sandler
item.description: Big news on the Vizio case - the court rejected Vizio's arguments in their summary judgment motion. The decision cuts to the core of the case, with clear and conclusive language. Now on to *our* motion for summary adjudication...https://sfconservancy.org/news/2024/jan/03/vizio-sj-rejected/

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
I am very saddened to learn of the passing of Peter Schiller. Peter was a great scientist. He took me under his wing when I started at MIT. I'll never forget him. Miss you, Peter.
#neuroscience

item.title: tomstafford
item.description: FRESH WORDSFrom me, on BBC FutureIt's about how a teenage achieved the impossible in an arcade game nearly three times older than him, about how communities support learning, and about why I'm optimistic about human flourishing in the digital agehttps://www.bbc.co.uk/future/article/20240103-tetris-how-a-us-teenager-achieved-the-impossible#learning #tetris #AI #CognitiveScience

item.title: Ulrike Franke
item.description: ‚ÄúThis perception of stalemate, however, is deeply flawed. Both Moscow and Kyiv are in a race to rebuild offensive combat power‚Ä¶.the materiel, personnel training, and casualties that each side accrues in the next few months will determine the long-term trajectory of the conflict.‚ÄùThe War in Ukraine Is Not a Stalemate | Foreign Affairshttps://www.foreignaffairs.com/ukraine/war-ukraine-not-stalemate

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: When I first started at MIT, Peter shared everything with me, copies of his grants, lab budget, much advice, etc. I used to have regular dinners with Peter. I learned to always let Peter choose the wine. If not, he would complain about the wine. :)

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: A new study shows that flowers have evolved over the past three decades to have less sex‚Äîpossibly in response to the disappearance of bees. It could be a death spiral for some species. Here‚Äôs my story. Gift link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/01/04/science/flower-sex-evolution-bees.html?mwgrp=a-dbar&unlocked_article_code=1.LE0._inN.7uQQgiu7kYGW&smid=url-share

item.title: Enron Hubbard
item.description:
For years, I‚Äôve been Bothered by things like dating apps and social media as superimposing consumer culture into intimacy and the Self. I‚Äôve talked with people about capitalism working its way up the hierarchy of needs, having long since colonized food and shelter and safety, now setting its sights on belonging, connection, and self-actualization.For the most part, people have made me feel like I‚Äôm being unnecessarily alarmist and out of touch for having this view. I‚Äôve questioned my sanity and relevance as a result.To hear Klein call this out directly, and speak about it as a profoundly painful experience, has been a vindicating relief. She‚Äôs right: it‚Äôs the last frontier of privatization, and it should horrify us all.From: @parismarx
https://mastodon.online/@parismarx/111698377449962827

item.title: Proton Mail
item.description: Meta wants you to keep Facebook Link History on, here‚Äôs why you shouldn‚Äôt:‚ÄúMeta injects special ‚Äúkeylogging‚Äù JavaScript onto the website you‚Äôre visiting that allows the company to monitor everything you type and tap on, including passwords.‚Äùhttps://gizmodo.com/meet-link-history-facebook-s-new-way-to-track-the-we-1851134018
